definition: change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.chinese: 我再无移情别恋的负罪感。

sentences.english: And if she finds that she would like to move into love with somebody else, it is perfectly okay.
sentences.chinese: 如果她发现她要移情别恋，那也完全没问题。

sentences.english: Mark knew that his goose was cooked when his girlfriend found him dating another girl.
sentences.chinese: 当马克被女友发现他移情别恋时，他知道自己完了。

sentences.english: It's definitely difficult to see him move on so quickly.
sentences.chinese: 真的很难接受看见他那么快便移情别恋。

sentences.english: After the husband leaves prison loves another, makes her to die by heartbreak.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫出狱后移情别恋，令她伤心欲绝。

sentences.english: Women also practise psychiatry. It's called empathy.
sentences.chinese: 女性也在练习精神病学，这就是我们常说的移情别恋。

sentences.english: Shang Xiyao thought empathy dont love the star, a walk it.
sentences.chinese: 汤喜耀以为星星移情别恋，一走了之。

definition: to cease to be faithful
to seek happiness elsewhere (euphemism for extramarital sex)/a bit on the side
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
to be madly in love
pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: (coll.) womanizer/skirt-chaser
to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
fickle in love/sentimentality
to fall in love
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
married man
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
